comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
More Bain/LOC photos of Corrections Commissioner Katharine Davis in action:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4786741203/in/photostream/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4786749031/]

[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4798745741/]

She took office on January 1, 1914, and these photos were taken soon afterward.

comment._content:
Bain/LOC photos of Dr. Katharine Davis, posted earlier:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4647154991/]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: LOC: Some sources on the internet spell her first name "Katherine," while others, including the peerless Wikipedia, go with "Katharine." You are the authority with responsibility to sort the matter out. An anxious nation waits upon your decision. Loyal citizens trust that you will not fail us in our hour of need.

comment.author: 51252716@N08
comment._content: I much prefer the style of portraits from years ago. The standard fake and forced smiles that infest all family photos of current generations are sickening. A photo is supposed to capture the moment, not an uninspired attempt to establish a weak veil of happiness over an otherwise dull existence.

comment.author: 33260754@N03
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/51252716@N08] what an interesting comment and to think places like flickr and other assorted photo websites just thrive on that sort of uninspired attempts at forced portraiture...probably why i avoid portraits all together

comment.author: 38328809@N02
comment._content: ^That and your likeness doesn't show up on film.
